title: When Closed-Loop Is Critical
content: Use closed-loop communication for all safety-critical instructions, whenever numbers or specific values are communicated, when actions are irreversible or difficult to reverse, and in high-noise environments. The brief time investment prevents catastrophic miscommunication.

mcq.question: Which situation most requires closed-loop communication?
mcq.explanation: Critical process parameters affect safety and operations. Errors are costly or dangerous. Closed-loop verification is essential. Routine scheduling and status don't carry the same risk.

openQuestions: What criteria determine when you use closed-loop communication?
Are there high-risk situations where your team doesn't consistently use closed-loop?
